series.title: Envoy AI Gateway v0.2.x
series.subtitle: Release version introducing Azure OpenAI integration, sidecar architecture, cross-backend failover, and a CLI tool.

releases.overview: Envoy AI Gateway v0.2.0 builds upon the solid foundation of v0.1.0 with focus on expanding provider ecosystem support, improving reliability and performance through architectural changes, and enterprise-grade authentication support for Azure OpenAI.

items.title: Full Azure OpenAI Support
items.description: Complete integration with Azure OpenAI services with request/response transformation for the unified OpenAI compatiple completions API.

items.title: Upstream Authentication for Azure Enterprise Integration
items.description: Support for accessing Azure via OIDC tokens and Entra ID for enterprise-grade authentication for secure and compliant upstream authentication.

items.title: Enterprise Proxy URL Support for Azure Authentication
items.description: Enhanced Azure authentication with proxy URL configuration options for enterprise proxy support.

items.title: Flexible Token Providers
items.description: Generalized token provider architecture supporting both client secret and federated token flows

items.title: Sidecar + UDS External Processor
items.description: Switched to sidecar deployment model with Unix Domain Sockets for improved performance and resource efficiency

items.title: Enhanced ExtProc Buffer Limits
items.description: Increased external processor buffer limits from 32 KiB to 50 MiB for larger AI requests. Users can now configure CPU and memory resource limits via filterConfig.externalProcessor.resources for better resource management.

items.title: Multiple AIGatewayRoute Support
items.description: Support for multiple AIGatewayRoute resources per gateway, removing the previous single-route limitation. This enables better organization, scalability, and management of complex routing configurations across teams.

items.title: Certificate Manager Integration
items.description: Integrated cert-manager for automated TLS certificate provisioning and rotation for the mutating webhook server that injects AI Gateway sidecar containers into Envoy Gateway pods. This enables enterprise-grade certificate management, eliminating manual certificate handling and improving security.

items.title: Provider Fallback Logic
items.description: Priority-based failover system that automatically routes traffic to lower priority AI providers as higher priority endpoints become unhealthy, ensuring high availability and fault tolerance.

items.title: Backend Retry Support
items.description: Configurable retry policies for improved reliability and resilience against AI provider transient failures. Features include exponential backoff with jitter, configurable retry triggers (5xx errors, connection failures, rate limiting), customizable retry counts and timeouts, and integration with Envoy Gateway's BackendTrafficPolicy.

items.title: Weight-Based Routing
items.description: Enhanced backend routing with weighted traffic distribution, enabling gradual rollouts, cost optimization, and A/B testing across multiple AI providers

items.title: aigw run Command
items.description: New CLI command for local development and testing of Envoy AI Gateway resources.

items.title: Configuration Translation
items.description: aigw translate for translating Envoy AI Gateway Resources to Envoy Gateway and Kubernetes CRDs.

apiChanges.title: AIGatewayRoute Metadata
apiChanges.description: Added ownedBy and createdAt fields for better resource tracking.

apiChanges.title: Backend Configuration
apiChanges.description: Moved Backend configuration back to RouteRule for improved flexibility.

apiChanges.title: OIDC Field Types
apiChanges.description: Specific typing for OIDC-related configuration fields.

apiChanges.title: Weight Type Changes
apiChanges.description: Updated Weight field type to match Gateway API specifications.

deprecations.title: AIServiceBackend.Timeouts
deprecations.description: Deprecated in favor of more granular timeout configuration.

bugFixes.title: ExtProc Image Syncing
bugFixes.description: Fixed issue where external processor image wouldn't sync properly.

bugFixes.title: Router Weight Validation
bugFixes.description: Fixed negative weight validation in routing logic.

bugFixes.title: Content Body Handling
bugFixes.description: Fixed empty content body issues causing AWS validation errors.

bugFixes.title: First Match Routing
bugFixes.description: Fixed router logic to ensure first match wins as expected.

breakingChanges.title: Sidecar Architecture
breakingChanges.description: The switch to sidecar + UDS model may require configuration updates for existing deployments.

breakingChanges.title: API Field Changes
breakingChanges.description: Some API fields have been moved or renamed - see migration guide for details. Please review the migration guide for details.

breakingChanges.title: Timeout Configuration
breakingChanges.description: Deprecated timeout fields require migration to new configuration format.

breakingChanges.title: Routing to Kubernetes Services
breakingChanges.description: Routing to Kubernetes services is not supported in Envoy AI Gateway v0.2.0. This is a known limitation and will be addressed in a future release.
